definition: to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: The two cars crossed on the road.
Just out of the company, they did meet right against the face walk to world.
sentences.chinese: 刚出了公司，他们就遇见迎面走来的世馨。

sentences.english: But the idea of tackling MDR-TB head-on has been a more recent development.
sentences.chinese: 但迎面对付耐多药结核病是最近的的新想法。

sentences.english: Stepping out of the aircraft, I was enveloped by tropical heat.

sentences.english: Two women, both lost in thought, walk toward each other.

sentences.english: 27When Jesus stepped ashore, he was met by a demon-possessed man from the town.

sentences.english: A sea gull flies right for you, but doesnt light on your outstretched hand.
